intro: Diplycosia kemulensis, commonly known as the Kemulensis mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Dipterocarps. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its specialized ecological role, it plays an important part in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
